jparsec.ephem.event

Class MoonEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.ephem.event.MoonEvent

  • public class MoonEvent
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to calculate events related to natural satellites.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)

    • Field Detail

      • SEVERAL_SIMULTANEOUS_EVENTS_MINIMUM_NUMBER

        public static int SEVERAL_SIMULTANEOUS_EVENTS_MINIMUM_NUMBER
        Sets the minimum number of simultaneous events to set the corresponding flag MoonEventElement.severalSimultaneousEvents as true. Default value is 2, but can be set to a greater value to search for more uncommon but interesting events.

      • SEVERAL_MUTUAL_SIMULTANEOUS_EVENTS_MINIMUM_NUMBER

        public static int SEVERAL_MUTUAL_SIMULTANEOUS_EVENTS_MINIMUM_NUMBER
        Sets the minimum number of simultaneous events to set the corresponding flag MoonEventElement.severalSimultaneousEvents as true, in case of mutual events between satellites. Default value is 2, but can be set to a greater value to search for more uncommon but interesting events.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MoonEvent

        public MoonEvent(TimeElement time,
         ObserverElement observer,
         EphemerisElement eph,
         TimeElement timef,
         int precision,
         int accuracy,
         boolean optimize)
          throws JPARSECException
        Base constructor to obtain moon events. L1 and TASS are the default theories for Jupiter and Saturn satellites.
        Parameters:
        time - Time object for the initial calculation time.
        observer - Observer object.
        eph - The ephemeris properties. The target should be the mother planet, for example Jupiter for galilean satellites. It is strongly recommended to set the ephemerides to geocentric to save time.
        timef - Time oject for the final calculation time.
        precision - Precision in seconds for the search. A good value for mutual phenomena is 30s (although in case you define the event as starting/ending with the center or the entire satellite disk, this value should be reduced to around 10s), and 100s for non-mutual phenomena. Note that the accuracy of the returned events is independent of this parameter. A value of 30s only means that some events of shorter duration could be missed.
        accuracy - This will be the accuracy in seconds of the returned event times. A good value is 1-10s for mutual events and 30s for non-mutual, but can be lower for Mars.
        optimize - True to optimize calculations for speed. This consists on forcing astrometric J2000 geocentric coordinates, reduced using IAU1976 algorithms, which are less CPU intensive. All posible corrections allowed in the ephemeris object are also disabled. Calculations can become 2.5 times faster, but slightly less accurate.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • MoonEvent

        public MoonEvent(TimeElement time,
         ObserverElement observer,
         EphemerisElement eph,
         TimeElement timef,
         int precision,
         int accuracy,
         boolean optimize,
         MoonEvent.JUPITER_THEORY jup,
         MoonEvent.SATURN_THEORY sat)
          throws JPARSECException
        Base constructor to obtain moon events, using the selected theories for Jupiter and Saturn satellites.
        Parameters:
        time - Time object for the initial calculation time.
        observer - Observer object.
        eph - The ephemeris properties. The target should be the mother planet, for example Jupiter for galilean satellites. It is strongly recommended to set the ephemerides to geocentric to save time.
        timef - Time oject for the final calculation time.
        precision - Precision in seconds for the search. A good value for mutual phenomena is 30s (although in case you define the event as starting/ending with the center or the entire satellite disk, this value should be reduced to around 10s), and 100s for non-mutual phenomena. Note that the accuracy of the returned events is independent of this parameter. A value of 30s only means that some events of shorter duration could be missed.
        accuracy - This will be the accuracy in seconds of the returned event times. A good value is 1-10s for mutual events and 30s for non-mutual, but can be lower for Mars.
        optimize - True to optimize calculations for speed. This consists on forcing astrometric J2000 geocentric coordinates, reduced using IAU1976 algorithms, which are less CPU intensive. All posible corrections allowed in the ephemeris object are also disabled. Calculations can become 2.5 times faster, but slightly less accurate.
        jup - Default theory to use for Jupiter satellites. L1 is very slow.
        sat - Default theory to use for Saturn satellites.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

    • Method Detail

      • setEventDefinition

        public static void setEventDefinition(MoonEvent.EVENT_DEFINITION ed)
        Sets how to consider the start/end of an event. Default value is when the center of the main body starts/ends crossing the limb or edge of the secondary body in non-mutual events, and when the satellite's limb starts/ends the transit on the secondary body in mutual events.
        Parameters:
        ed - An event definition.

      • getEventDefinition

        public static MoonEvent.EVENT_DEFINITION getEventDefinition()
        Returns how to consider the start/end of an event.
        Returns:
        The event definition.

      • getMutualPhenomena

        public MoonEventElement[] getMutualPhenomena(boolean all)
                                      throws JPARSECException
        Obtains all mutual phenomena. Supported objects are Mars (2007 numerical integration theory), Jupiter (L1 theory), Saturn (TASS 1.7), and Uranus (GUST86).
        Parameters:
        all - True to return all events including occultations/eclipses by the mother planet itself. Note that in the latter case only events in a partial phase will be returned, i.e., the interval while the eclipse/occultation is in progress.
        Returns:
        Events visible for the observer. Those events that started before the initial time and persists at the initial time will have invalid initial times (jd = 0).
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getLightCurve

        public CreateChart getLightCurve(MoonEventElement event,
                        TimeElement.SCALE outputTimeScale,
                        boolean magnitude,
                        boolean combined)
                          throws JPARSECException
        Obtains the light curve of a given mutual event.
        Parameters:
        event - Event to calculate. Must have valid initial/ending times.
        outputTimeScale - Time scale for the x axis. Constants define in TimeElement.
        magnitude - True to represent magnitude instead of non-eclipsed/oculted disk fraction.
        combined - True to represent combined magnitudes of the two satellites. If the chart represents non-eclipsed/oculted disk fraction, this parameter will have no effect.
        Returns:
        The chart.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getPhenomena

        public MoonEventElement[] getPhenomena()
                                throws JPARSECException
        Obtains all non-mutual phenomena (eclipses, occultations, transits, shadow transits). Supported objects are Mars (2007 numerical integration theory), Jupiter (L1 theory), Saturn (TASS 1.7), and Uranus (GUST86).
        Returns:
        Events visible for the observer. Those events that started before the initial time and persists at the initial time will have invalid initial times (jd = 0).
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getPathChart

        public CreateChart getPathChart(double step,
                       boolean arcseconds,
                       boolean projectToEquator)
                         throws JPARSECException
        Creates a chart with the paths of the satellites.
        Parameters:
        step - The step in days between consecutive points. 1 hour is a good value, but the total computing time could be several minutes for one month of time span or more.
        arcseconds - True to select arcseconds as output unit, false for planetary radii.
        projectToEquator - True to project to planet equator (strongly recommended). If false the offsets will be the total radial distance, that will never be 0 unless the inclination of the planet equator respect to Earth is zero.
        Returns:
        The chart.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        For unit testing only.
        Parameters:
        args - Not used.
